tool.name: GROMACS Radius of Gyration
tool.command:
ln -s '$traj_input' ./traj_input.${traj_input.ext} && ln -s '$structure_input' ./structure_input.${structure_input.ext} && ln -s '$ndx_input' ./ndx_input.ndx &&
echo '$index' | gmx gyrate -f './traj_input.${traj_input.ext}' -s './structure_input.${structure_input.ext}' -n './ndx_input.ndx' -o rg.xvg
>> verbose.txt 2>&1

param.name: ndx_input
param.label: Index (NDX) file
param.help: Index file containing the molecules of interest

param.name: index
param.label: Index of group
param.help: Index of group for calculating the radius of gyration - i.e. the group's position in the ndx file (using zero-based numbering, so the first group has index 0).

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This tool computes the radius of gyration of a molecular structure. The usefulness of this value is that it provides the researcher with an idea of how compact versus how open or extended the molecule's most commonly adopted conformation is, and how it changes throughout a set of trajectories. It can often be determined experimentally, so computing this from a simulation and comparing the results can also allow the researcher to verify the accuracy of the chosen force field for that particular system.
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
- TPR file of the simulated system.. - XTC or TRR trajectory file from a prior simulation. - Index file generated using make_ndx..
_____
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
- XVG file containing the radius of gyration at every frame of the trajectory.
